headline.main: THE WAR IN ARKANSAS.; FROM GEN. CURTIS' COLUMN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The movement of the army from Cassville to Forsyth, through a wild, mountainous country, which has now occupied six days, has afforded no opportunity for writing or sending communications. South of Springfield there is no mail, and the telegraph and Government Express are in the control of the Commanding-General. Letters can only be sent through the Government Express as a personal favor or by the slow conveyance of commissary wagons.

docs.snippet: STATED SESSION Monday, April 21, 1862. The Board met pursuant to adjournment. The  President being absent, on motion of Alderman Jeremiah, Alderman Chipp was appointed Chairman pro- blem.

headline.main: THE CITY GOVERNMENT.; [OFFICIAL.] BOARD OF ALDERMEN. [OFFICIAL.] BOARD OF COUNCILMEN. PETITIONS. RESOLUTIONS. REPORTS. MOTIONS. COMMUNICATIONS. AN ORDINANCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: STATED SESSION Monday, April 21, 1862. The Board met pursuant to adjournment. The President being absent, on motion of Alderman Jeremiah, Alderman Chipp was appointed Chairman pro- blem.
